result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joseph D Erdman

defendant.name: Erdman, Joseph D
defendant.address: S50 W36814 County Rd CI, Dousman, WI 53188

records.addlTxt:
9:36 AM Defendant Joseph D Erdman in court. District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Jack Rieder. 
Victim rights have been complied with by the Waukesha County District Attorneys Office. 
Defendant does not plan to have counsel. 
State places offer on the record. 
Defendant would like more time in this matter to complete  counseling.
Hearing scheduled for December 27, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Cash bail previously posted to be refunded to poster. Defendant is not to have any violent contact with victim A/witnesses A & B listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.   Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.

9:30 AM District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Niki Kane. Defendant Joseph D Erdman in court. 

Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint. 
Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties. 
Court advises of right to an attorney. Defendant is not eligible for State Public Defender representation. The Defendant given the Petition for Court Appointed Counsel paperwork in court.
NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.
Hearing scheduled for September 26, 2022 at 09:30 am.
To Seal Victim/Witness Identification Key signed by Judge Bugenhagen Jr. on August 5, 2022
Victim/Witness Identification Key filed, under seal, by the District Attorney's office.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection and Notice of Intent to Use Defendant's Statement and DNA Evidence.
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Prosecutor
